intro: Caraguata hygrometrica, commonly known as the hygrometric caraguata, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid environments with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
